column4: Anybody know why they're ignoring a bug I filed for emacs in launchpad?  Is this common to ignore it?
if it's something obscure or not easily reproduced..

well, i posted a thread on comp.lang.python, and they reproduced it.  It's weird because it has to do with the python debugger under emacs.  And, I thought a lot of Canonical developers use python.  I'm sure they also use emacs as ubiquitous as it is.
then I don't know.. perhaps they will get to it in time... you'll have to ask the people responsible if you want a better answer, sorry
okay, thanks, guess i just wanted somewhere to complain... i probably will look at the package name and email an author...
wanna make sure it gets fixed in the next release, i've stayed quiet before, and the bug that affected me was still there in the next release, ticked me off
hehe.. well, nag a bit.. it might help =)
i'll just email an author of the package...
really, i guess RMS is the lead developer on emacs, i wonder if he'd respond?
hehe.. wonder how many emails he gets a day.. hundred? more?
you know, he used to have his user account set up at MIT (where he works) so that anyone could telnet in and read his mail.
he really didn't get that many emails a day, but that was before the days of spam
talking the talk and walking the walk.. impressive
yeah, it was one of his pro-sharing, anti-security beliefs that made him do that
he actually had a message popping up when you logged in saying "please don't delete any of my email!!!"
perhaps I should enable remote ssh, root/root and have that in the motd.. wonder how long it would be before my computer was busy spamming the world about v1agra etc =)
yeah, like i said, this was maybe 12 years ago, before spam really caught on.  The best porn used to be on Usenet.
Now, it's rare to find a good usenet group.
yea.. I remember when our ISP's in sweden still carried the binary groups.. nowdays they hardly carry the text only groups
porn, or otherwise, i don't even look anymore
there's a web interface to ubuto that you can go in and fill in answers for
huh?
user space file system block device.. or somthing like that
